If you enjoyed the gritty, intense vibe of American Gangster, I'd recommend Hart's War (2002). This war drama stars Colin Farrell as a law student-turned-lieutenant who must defend a wrongly accused prisoner of war, and it has a similar sense of tension and urgency. Plus, with a strong cast like Bruce Willis and Cole Hauser, you know you're in for a compelling watch!

If you'd like something a bit more lighthearted but still action-packed, This Means War (2012) might be up your alley. It's an all-star romp featuring Reese Witherspoon, Chris Pine, and Tom Hardy as rival C.I.A. operatives vying for the same woman's affections.
